title: Net magnetic field due to two wires

content.question: Which of the following expressions represents the magnitude of the magnetic field at point <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction mu sub 0, end sub, I, over 2 pi d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction mu sub 0, end sub, I, over pi d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 4 mu sub 0, end sub, I, over 3 pi d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 2 mu sub 0, end sub, I, over 3 pi d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 2 mu sub 0, end sub, I, over 3 pi d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
